business.headline: Wipro shares tank 6% in early trade despite strong Q4 earnings. Buy or sell?At 9:20 am, Wipro shares were trading 5.33% lower at Rs 234.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. The decline came after the company reported its earnings post-market hours on Wednesday.

Sensex loses over 300 points in early trade, Nifty below 23,400; Wipro down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 344.50 points to 76,700.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 119.70 points to 23,317.50 as of 9:30 am.

Rio Tinto partners with Indian firm to explore low-carbon aluminium projectThe potential development could see up to 1 million tonnes per annum (mtpa) of primary aluminium smelting and 2 mtpa of alumina production, both energized by renewable wind and solar power, supported by pumped hydro storage, the global miner said.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open lower. Here's whyDespite the weak outlook for Thursday's session, Sensex and Nifty have seen a strong upward trend in the last few days. In the past three sessions, Nifty50 has gone up by 4.6% while Sensex has gained 4.3%.

Stocks to watch on April 17: Wipro, Gensol, Tata Steel, BEL, Paytm, Hero MotoCorpSeveral companies will announce their results for Q4 FY25 on Thursday. These include Infosys, HDFC Life Insurance Company, Jio Financial Services, HDFC Asset Management Company, Tata Elxsi, National Standard (India), and E2E Networks.

TCS gets 21 acres in Visakhapatnam for just 99 paisa as Andhra bets big on techThe cabinet of Andhra Pradesh cleared the proposal on Tuesday, stating that the project is expected to bring in an investment of around Rs 1,370 crore and create nearly 12,000 jobs.

Old or New Tax Regime: Here's how to pick the right one before filing ITRUnder the old tax regime, taxpayers can claim various deductions and exemptions, while the new tax regime does not offer much deductions.

ITR filing: How is tax refund calculated, and when will you get it?When you file your return, you declare your income, claim deductions, and report taxes already paid. The tax system compares your actual tax due with what you've already paid. If you've paid more, the extra amount is returned to you as a refund.
Wipro Q4 results: Net profit rises 26% to Rs 3,570 croreRevenue from operations saw a modest 1% year-on-year increase, reaching Rs 22,504 crore, compared to Rs 22,208 crore in Q4FY24.
Sensex closes 300 points higher, Nifty above 23,400; banking stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex added 309.40 points to close at 77,044.29, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 108.65 points to end at 23,437.20.

Inside Gensol's loan fraud: The fake documents used to hide debtSebi found that when the credit rating agencies asked Gensol to share term loan statements from all its lenders, the company shared documents for most lenders, except for IREDA and PFC.

White House fact sheet sparks confusion about 245% tariff on ChinaWhile a White House fact sheet mentions that China now faces up to 245% tariffs, the usual brouhaha by Donald Trump while making such announcements was missing.

entertainment.headline: Apoorva Mukhija hints at vacating Mumbai house after India's Got Latent rowInfluencer and actor Apoorva Mukhija seemed to have moved out of her Mumbai house, months after India's Got Latent controversy. She shared a short video giving a glimpse of the empty house.

Picture abhi baki hai: Ranveer Allahbadia says 'brother' Samay Raina will be backRanveer Allahbadia conducted an 'Ask Me Anything' session on Instagram addressing the India's Got Latent controversy and the events that followed. He revealed stronger ties with Samay Raina and support for Ashish Chanchlani and Apoorva Mukhija.

Prithviraj and Malayalam celebs honoured at Kerala State Film Awards presentationChief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan presented Kerala State Film Awards (2023) in Thiruvananthapuram on Wednesday. Prithviraj Sukumaran, Urvashi and many others were honoured for their exceptional work.

Anurag Kashyap slams Brahmin outfits opposing Phule, calls out rigged systemAnurag Kashyap criticised Brahminical groups for opposing Hindi film 'Phule', highlighting issues of casteism and a compromised system. He questioned the access that fringe groups have to unreleased films and called out censorship practices.

Vijay Sethupathi reflects on working with director Puri JagannadhVijay Sethupathi recently shared his excitement about collaborating with director Puri Jagannadh. On being asked about the collaboration, he said it was the story that convinced him, not the filmmaker's past track record.
Stand-up comedian Nate Bargatze to host Emmys 2025Stand-up comedian Nate Bargatze will host the 77th Emmy Awards, live from Los Angeles. The event will take place on September 15 IST.

Citadel spin-offs cancelled, to merge storylines into main seriesPrime Video has decided not to continue with 'Citadel' spinoffs 'Honey Bunny' and 'Diana' as standalone series. Instead, their storylines will be integrated into the second season of 'Citadel', set for a global release in 2026.

Lebanon bans Disney's Snow White over Gal Gadot's support for IsraelLebanon has prohibited the screening of Disney's 'Snow White' due to the casting of Israeli actor Gal Gadot. The ban aligns with the country's ongoing boycott of Israeli artists amid regional tensions.

Actor Nazriya Nazim Fahadh 'struggling with emotional well-being': I shut downNazriya Nazim Fahadh opened up about her recent absence from the public eye, explaining that it was due to struggles with emotional well-being. She also extended her apologies and gratitude to her friends and supporters.

Pooja Hegde on break from Telugu films: Felt like a missing childPooja Hegde recently talked about why she has stayed away from Telugu films. She also spoke about her upcoming projects, and her return to Tollywood.

SS Rajamouli recalls Jr NTR's Komuram Bheemudo shoot in RRR: Tarak was possessed'RRR' director SS Rajamouli, who was in Japan to promote his Netflix documentary 'RRR: Behind and Beyond', praised Jr NTR's performance in the song 'Komuram Bheemudo', while interacting with the media.

Rohit Shetty, John Abraham join hands for Rakesh Maria's biopicJohn Abraham and Rohit Shetty are joining hands for a new film inspired by Rakesh Maria's life. The project will explore Maria's illustrious career in the Mumbai Police.

Radhika Apte to join Tabu and Vijay Sethupathi in Puri Jagannadh's next: ReportAfter years away from Telugu cinema, Radhika Apte is reportedly reuniting with filmmaker Puri Jagannadh for an intense pan-India project, also starring Vijay Sethupathi and Tabu.

Eddington teaser: Joaquin Phoenix, Pedro Pascal clash in Ari Aster's black comedyThe teaser of Ari Aster's latest film, 'Eddington', released on April 15. A black comedy, Eddington is set to premiere at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival.

How Nidhhi Agerwal transformed into a princess for Hari Hara Veera MalluTelugu-Tamil star Nidhhi Agerwal gears up for two major releases with Pawan Kalyan and Prabhas. In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, she spoke about 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu', working with the two stars and more.

Kannada superstar Upendra explains how Coolie co-star Rajinikanth inspired himKannada actor-director Upendra, while interacting with the media at a press meet held in Hyderabad to promote his upcoming Kannada film '45', spoke about how he considered himself blessed to have had the opportunity to work with him.

Tamannaah on 'milky beauty' tag: I don't want to play the victimTamannaah Bhatia, during the promotion of her upcoming supernatural thriller, 'Odela 2', remarked that she does not want to "be in a victim-mode".

The Patriotism pattern: Why Akshay Kumar keeps returning to nationalist rolesAkshay Kumar returns to his patriotic roots with 'Kesari Chapter 2', portraying the role of C Sankaran Nair in a courtroom drama set against the backdrop of the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. Known for his consistent portrayal of nationalistic themes, Akshay remains Bollywood's go-to figure for films that resonate with Indian pride.

Gene Hackman's wife Googled flu symptoms days before death: ReportAuthorities have revealed that Gene Hackman, 95, and his wife Betsy Arakawa, 65, died in their Santa Fe home from natural causes—Arakawa from rare hantavirus and Hackman from heart disease worsened by Alzheimer's. New details shed light on Arakawa's health concerns before her death and confirm no foul play was involved.

general news.headline: BCCI sacks batting, fielding coaches after poor show in Border–Gavaskar TrophyBCCI has removed four support staff members, including coaches Abhishek Nayar and T. Dilip over India's 1-3 series loss in Australia.

Tariffs capable of replacing income tax? Trump says there's a 'real chance'Drawing on historical precedent, Donald Trump argued that between 1870 and 1913, tariffs served as the primary source of government revenue and coincided with a period when the nation was "relatively the richest".

I was pilot when development took off, now Fadnavis flying it: Eknath ShindeMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde likened the Mahayuti government to a "development aircraft," saying he was its pilot with Fadnavis and Ajit Pawar as co-pilots.

BJP likely to get new chief by April-end as state-level polls conclude: SourcesSo far, 14 state presidents have been appointed, but as per the party's constitution, elections must be held in at least 19 states before the national presidential election can be conducted.

Picture abhi baki hai: Ranveer Allahbadia says 'brother' Samay Raina will be backRanveer Allahbadia conducted an 'Ask Me Anything' session on Instagram addressing the India's Got Latent controversy and the events that followed. He revealed stronger ties with Samay Raina and support for Ashish Chanchlani and Apoorva Mukhija.

Trump, Musk, Yunus among Time's 100 most influential people, no Indian in listTime magazine has released the 2025 edition of the 100 most influential people in the world, featuring prominent world leaders, including US President Donald Trump and Bangladesh's Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus. However, no Indian was found in the list.

Sensex loses over 300 points in early trade, Nifty below 23,400; Wipro down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 344.50 points to 76,700.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 119.70 points to 23,317.50 as of 9:30 am.

Iran 'not far' from nuclear bomb, warns UN watchdog chief Rafael GrossiThe IAEA remains tasked with monitoring Iran's nuclear activities and its compliance with the 2015 nuclear agreement, which began to unravel in 2018 following the US withdrawal under then-President Donald Trump.

Watch: Neeraj Chopra begins 2025 season with winning throw at South Africa eventAhead of next month's Doha Diamond League, Neeraj Chopra competed in an invitational event in Potchefstroom, South Africa. Neeraj topped a six-man field with a best effort of 84.52m on Wednesday, April 16.

How Tejashwi gave Rahul, Kharge a Bihar poll reality checkIn 2020, the Congress contested a disproportionate number of seats, winning under a third of them and denying the RJD-led alliance a shot at power. Will 2025 be different?

Trump holds surprise tariff talks with Japan, claims 'big progress'President Trump met unexpectedly with Japan's trade delegation, calling the talks "big progress" as both sides agreed to hold a second meeting soon.

Fatwa against actor Vijay for controversial iftar party: He invited alcoholicsA Muslim cleric from Uttar Pradesh issued a fatwa against actor-politician Thalapathy Vijay. The Sunni ulema accused the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam chief of anti-Islamic conduct and political opportunism.

Why you can bet big on Haryana's Hisar, ready for take-off with a new airportA new airport isn't just bringing regional connectivity to Hisar, it is galvanising the steel city for a big leap into the future. Matching the Centre's big plans for Hisar as a defence-manufacturing and aviation-sector hub, Haryana itself is moving to put Hisar as a counter-magnet city outside the NCR.

Apoorva Mukhija hints at vacating Mumbai house after India's Got Latent rowInfluencer and actor Apoorva Mukhija seemed to have moved out of her Mumbai house, months after India's Got Latent controversy. She shared a short video giving a glimpse of the empty house.

Undoing 'waqf by user' will have huge consequences: Top court's big remarksThe Supreme Court, hearing 73 petitions challenging the Waqf Amendment Act, said that denotifying the properties of the 'waqf by user', would have huge consequences, but stopped short of passing interim orders.

We will beat the hell out of you: Pakistan Army chief warns Baloch terroristsIn a spirited address, the army chief dismissed the idea that "1500 terrorists" could alter the course of the nation's future, promising a swift and forceful response.

Strongest signs yet of life found on distant exoplanet in landmark discoveryScientists have detected possible biosignature gases in the atmosphere of exoplanet K2-18 b -- gases produced only by life on Earth -- hinting at the presence of microbial life.

China's Jinping backs Southeast Asian nations to counter Trump tariffsXi is visiting Vietnam, Malaysia and Cambodia this week, days after US President Donald Trump's tariff announcements disrupted the global economy, and he has used the trip to promote Beijing as a source of stability in the region.

Anurag Kashyap slams Brahmin outfits opposing Phule, calls out rigged systemAnurag Kashyap criticised Brahminical groups for opposing Hindi film 'Phule', highlighting issues of casteism and a compromised system. He questioned the access that fringe groups have to unreleased films and called out censorship practices.

Watch: Hasan Ali apologises for 'King kar lega' remark to Babar AzamPakistan fast bowler Hasan Ali has apologised for his 'King Kar Lega' remark to Babar Azam in 2023. The fast bowler plays for Karachi Kings in the Pakistan Super League 2025.

North Korea building its largest-ever warship, satellite images revealNorth Korea is constructing a potentially helicopter-capable guided missile frigate, representing a major advancement in its naval capabilities and signalling a strategic shift toward enhanced maritime power projection.

Trump asks revenue agency to cancel defiant Harvard's tax-exempt status: ReportThe Trump administration has urged the IRS to revoke Harvard's tax-exempt status due to concerns over its handling of antisemitism and diversity policies. No decision has been made yet, but Harvard has already lost over $2 billion in federal funding.

Saliva a game changer in IPL 2025? Starc disagrees after Super Over heroicsIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Mitchell Starc said he prefers using sweat over saliva on the red-ball. On Wednesday, Starc helped the Delhi Capitals beat the Rajasthan Royals in the Super Over clash at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

Woman sexually exploited on pretext of getting nurse's job at Lucknow hospitalA woman has claimed she was sexually exploited by a man who lured her to get a nurse's job at Lucknow's King George's Medical University (KGMU) in Lucknow. Police have registered a case against the accused.

sports.headline: BCCI sacks batting, fielding coaches after poor show in Border–Gavaskar TrophyTeam India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar and fielding coach T Dilip have been relieved of their duties over the horror series loss in Australia.

Nitish Rana breaks silence on Super Over snub vs DC: All decisions were rightDespite being RR's top performer with the bat, Nitish Rana stood by the management's call to send Riyan Parag and Shimron Hetmyer for the Super Over. RR's decisions in the key clash sparked criticism after DC clinched a tense win.

Watch: Hasan Ali apologises for 'King kar lega' remark to Babar AzamPakistan fast bowler Hasan Ali has apologised for his 'King Kar Lega' remark to Babar Azam in 2023. The fast bowler plays for Karachi Kings in the Pakistan Super League 2025.

Watch: Neeraj Chopra begins 2025 season with winning throw at South Africa eventAhead of next month's Doha Diamond League, Neeraj Chopra competed in an invitational event in Potchefstroom, South Africa. Neeraj topped a six-man field with a best effort of 84.52m on Wednesday, April 16.

UCL: Real Madrid's 'remontada' fails vs Arsenal, Bayern fall to InterA night of contrasting emotions in Europe — Real Madrid's fabled comebacks fell flat, and Thomas Müller bid a tearful goodbye to Champions League glory as Arsenal and Inter Milan marched into the semi-finals.

Saliva a game changer in IPL 2025? Starc disagrees after Super Over heroicsIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Mitchell Starc said he prefers using sweat over saliva on the red-ball. On Wednesday, Starc helped the Delhi Capitals beat the Rajasthan Royals in the Super Over clash at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

Naman Dhir welcomes dry ball rule as relief for bowlersIPL 2025, MI vs SRH: In the pre-match press conference, Naman Dhir said that the introduction of the second ball has helped bowlers mostly because of dew playing big part in matches.

12 yorkers in 12 balls: Axar in awe of Starc after Super Over winIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Axar Patel heaped praise on Mitchell Starc, who won the Player of the Match award after Delhi Capitals beat Rajasthan Royals in the Super Over on Wednesday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.

DC vs RR: Sanju Samson doffs his hat to Mitchell Starc's genius after losing Super OverRajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson was left in awe of Delhi Capitals speedster Mitchell Starc following their loss in the super over in Match 32 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Delhi Capitals reclaim top spot after Super Over thriller vs RoyalsIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Delhi Capitals edged past Rajasthan Royals in a thriller after the match on Wednesday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi went right down to the Super Over.

IPL 2025: Parag uses same bat after umpire struggles to pass it through gaugeRajasthan Royals (RR) batter Riyan Parag's bat failed to pass through the measuring gauge against Delhi Capitals (DC) during Match 32 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). However, he was still allowed to use it during his innings.

Naman Dhir welcomes dry ball rule as relief for bowlersIPL 2025, MI vs SRH: In the pre-match press conference, Naman Dhir said that the introduction of the second ball has helped bowlers mostly because of dew playing big part in matches.

12 yorkers in 12 balls: Axar in awe of Starc after Super Over winIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Axar Patel heaped praise on Mitchell Starc, who won the Player of the Match award after Delhi Capitals beat Rajasthan Royals in the Super Over on Wednesday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.

DC vs RR: Sanju Samson doffs his hat to Mitchell Starc's genius after losing Super OverRajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson was left in awe of Delhi Capitals speedster Mitchell Starc following their loss in the super over in Match 32 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Delhi Capitals reclaim top spot after Super Over thriller vs RoyalsIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Delhi Capitals edged past Rajasthan Royals in a thriller after the match on Wednesday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi went right down to the Super Over.

IPL 2025: Parag uses same bat after umpire struggles to pass it through gaugeRajasthan Royals (RR) batter Riyan Parag's bat failed to pass through the measuring gauge against Delhi Capitals (DC) during Match 32 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). However, he was still allowed to use it during his innings.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
